title: US appeals court rules Trump can be prosecuted for plot to overturn 2020 election
summary: The Court repealed Donald Trump's claim that he was immune from prosecution for actions taken as president.

title: French multinational Lactalis raided on suspicion of massive tax evasion
summary: According to Le Monde, the investigation by the French National Financial Prosecutor's Office is aimed at determining whether the dairy giant evaded French tax by transferring profits to its companies in Belgium and Luxembourg.

title: French politicians pause discord to pay tribute to citizens who died on October 7
summary: On Wednesday, President Emmanuel Macron is holding a ceremony to pay tribute to 42 French citizens who died in Hamas's attack against Israel. In the build-up, the radical left party La France Insoumise called for a similar tribute to those killed by Israeli bombardments in Gaza.

title: Biden's immigration chief survives impeachment vote
summary: House Republicans on Tuesday failed to impeach Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas as a few GOP lawmakers diverged from the party line.

title: Sebastian Piñera, former Chilean president, dies in a helicopter crash
summary: Piñera, 74, served two non-consecutive terms in office, between 2010 and 2014 and again from 2018 to 2022.

title: Syria: The forgotten victims, one year after the deadly earthquake
summary: After substantial initial emergency aid, support for Syrians in the northwestern rebel-controlled region has dried up.

title: EU's von der Leyen backtracks on cutting pesticide use
summary: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the proposal to halve chemical pesticide use in the EU by the end of the decade had 'become a symbol of polarization.'

title: Alaska Airlines incident: Investigation reveals missing bolts caused mid-flight panel loss
summary: Written documents and photos show that Boeing employees removed four bolts that helped secure a panel to the frame of the 737 Max 9 during an inspection at the Renton plant in Washington State prior to delivery of the aircraft last October.

title: French left-wing MPs visit Gaza border, in show of support to Palestinians
summary: A group of lawmakers led by members of the radical left La France Insoumise party visited the Rafah border crossing between Egypt and the Palestinian territory.

title: Attal on his first days as French PM: 'I was thrown into the deep end straight away'
summary: The new prime minister spoke to Le Monde on the sidelines of his trip to Berlin, where he met with Chancellor Olaf Scholz. He discussed the fight against the far right, the recent farmers' protests, and the second wave of government appointments.

title: Nevada Republicans vote in jumble of primaries and caucuses
summary: Silver State voters go to the polls Tuesday for a primary and Thursday for caucuses. But only the caucuses will count towards the presidential nomination, and Donald Trump's opponent Nikki Haley isn't taking part.

title: Paris Olympics chief faces legal probe over pay
summary: An inquiry will look into how the Paris 2024 Olympics chief organizer Tony Estanguet receives his pay.

title: Biden confuses Macron with dead French president Mitterrand
summary: The US president's gaffe came at a campaign speech in Las Vegas. He also misstated Mitterrand's country as Germany, before correcting himself.

title: Vittorio Emanuele of Savoy, son of Italy's last king, has died
summary: Banned from Italy for over half a century, the head of the House of Savoy was able to return to Rome in 2002. He died on February 3, at his home in Geneva, Switzerland.

title: Paris station knife attacker sought to 'target French people,' says prosecutor
summary: The man who injured three people at Gare de Lyon on Saturday has been charged with attempted murder and aggravated assault with a weapon.

title: Senegal's postponed election: How Macky Sall plunged the country into uncertainty
summary: In announcing the indefinite postponement of the February 25 presidential election, President Sall said he wanted a 'free, transparent and inclusive' election to be held. However, his decision is being contested.

title: Turkey earthquake one year on: 'The story is far from over'
summary: One year after the earthquake killed over 53,500 people, Turkey's southern provinces are still extremely damaged by the disaster and face an opaque reconstruction process.

title: One year after the earthquake in Turkey, a small town fights through tears for justice
summary: The disaster killed more than 53,000 people on February 6, 2023, and the inhabitants of one town are determined to hold those who they say are responsible for these deaths to account.

title: Tucker Carlson says he will soon interview Putin in Moscow
summary: Carlson, known for radical conservative opinions that have garnered a vast right-wing following, did not specify when the interview will be broadcast but mentioned that it will be free to watch on his personal website.

title: Red Sea crisis weighs on Italian economy
summary: Houthi rebel attacks off Yemen's coast are disrupting exports from the peninsula, half of which rely on maritime transit.

title: The challenges for France's cultural diplomacy in China
summary: Many events have been organized to celebrate 60 years of relations between Paris and Beijing. They present a balancing act determined not to disturb Chinese sensibilities.

title: US lawmakers reject $17.6 billion aid bill for Israel
summary: The bill was defeated in the US House of Representatives on Tuesday, thwarting Speaker Mike Johnson's effort to isolate Israel's aid from other security priorities like Ukraine's defense against Russia and US-Mexico border control.

title: China prefers to stay on the sidelines of the Middle East
summary: Beijing views the escalating tensions off Yemen's coast as an extension of the Israel-Hamas conflict and is resisting US calls to leverage its influence over Iran.

title: Coca-Cola, sponsor of the Paris 2024 Olympics and still 'world champion' in plastic pollution
summary: The 2023 rankings by the NGO Break Free From Plastic show the multinational leading in waste accumulation in public spaces during cleanup operations.

title: Argentina: Milei's economic reforms hit parliamentary roadblock
summary: Lawmakers halted President Javier Milei's contentious deregulatory reform agenda, sending it back for revisions.

title: Haley embarrassed after 'none of these candidates' Nevada GOP loss, Biden secures easy Democratic win
summary: Republican Nikki Haley became the first presidential candidate from either party to lose a race to 'none of these candidates' since that option was introduced in Nevada in 1975. Joe Biden won the Nevada primary with virtually no opposition.

title: Parts of Kyiv without power after strikes on Ukraine
summary: One person has been reported dead and residential buildings damaged in Mykolaiv. Blasts were heard in the capital.

title: Senegal election postponement: 'A dark stain on the country's history and a blow to West Africa'
summary: Francis Laloupo, an expert in African geopolitics and emerging conflicts, reacts to President Macky Sall's decision to postpone the Senegalese presidential election.

title: In deserted northern Israel, some kibbutz inhabitants push for war
summary: In the evacuated kibbutz of Kfar Giladi, on the border with Lebanon, a group of Israelis who stayed behind have taken on the role of lookouts to secure the strip of land targeted daily by Hezbollah fire.

title: TotalEnergies makes its biggest profit ever
summary: The oil and gas giant earned $21.4 billion in net income in 2023.

title: In the Netherlands, a toxic atmosphere prevails within public television
summary: Harassment, physical or sexual assault: Three-quarters of the employees questioned by a commission of inquiry said they had already been victims or witnesses of 'inappropriate behavior.'

title: Olympic Broadcasting Services, the secretive company behind the Games
summary: Unknown to the general public, the IOC subsidiary responsible for capturing the images and sounds of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games is as demanding as it is powerful. Broadcasters and public authorities have little leeway.

title: Prince Harry's crusade against the British tabloids
summary: Profoundly affected by the media's treatment of his family, King Charles III's youngest son is taking all-out legal action against the popular dailies that exploit celebrities' private lives.

title: 'Does the European Central Bank have a Lagarde problem?'
summary: Faced with rejection from a large number of European Central Bank employees who consider their president incompetent, Christine Lagarde has countered that economists are a 'tribal clique,' observes Le Monde's Eric Albert in his column.

title: Macron says Hamas attack on Israel was 'biggest anti-Semitic massacre of our century'
summary: France paid tribute to French victims of Hamas' October 7 attack in a national ceremony led by President Emmanuel Macron in Paris on Wednesday.

title: 'As confrontation replaces cooperation, the question of nuclear deterrence takes on a whole new meaning'
summary: The war in Ukraine and the possibility of Donald Trump's return to the White House have put the atomic weapon and its role in Europe's defense back at the center of the strategic debate, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Donald Trump must face justice
summary: Facing several judicial cases, the former US president is doing his utmost to curb and delay them until after the November presidential election, in the hope that a victory will enable him to remain unaccountable.

title: Ukraine's security service under fire after surveilling journalists
summary: The Bihus.info website traced the trail of SBU officers who placed cameras in a hotel to spy on and compromise their reporters. The Ukrainian security service's chief condemned its 'unacceptable' actions.

title: Record levels of 'forever chemicals' found in one French village's water supply
summary: Unprecedented analyses are revealing spectacular levels of trifluoroacetic acid (TFA) in streams around a PFAS production plant in Salindres, in southern France, as well as in the village's drinking water.

title: Senegalese presidential candidate Khalifa Sall: Election delay is 'a coup d'état that doesn't speak its name'
summary: The former mayor of Dakar, one of the presidential favorites, calls on the Senegalese people to mobilize 'by all means' against Macky Sall's decision to postpone the election

title: 'It's the story of a kidnapped child': Actress Judith Godrèche accuses director Benoît Jacquot of rape
summary: Based on interviews, documents, and witnesses, Le Monde investigated the 'grip' exerted on a young girl by a well-known filmmaker during the 1980s. He claims they had a loving relationship.
